thread.section_title: NWAonline stories: High School Sports - Northwest Arkansas
thread.title: Siloam Springs clinches playoff berth

title: Siloam Springs clinches playoff berth
text:
Siloam Springs clinches playoff berth By Graham Thomas Posted: October 16, 2015 at 1 a.m. 
SILOAM SPRINGS -- It's been a tough volleyball season in Siloam Springs, but the Lady Panthers were able to celebrate on Thursday night. 
Siloam Springs rallied from a 2-0 deficit and clinched a Class 6A playoff berth with a 3-2 (26-28, 21-25, 25-14, 25-16, 18-16) win against Alma at Panther Activity Center. 
Siloam Springs (8-22, 3-10 7A/6A-Central) came into Thursday night's match needing to defeat the Airedalettes by any margin to clinch a playoff spot. 
Senior defensive specialist Sam Wetzel's ace clinched the victory in a marathon game five that saw the Lady Panthers hold match-point three times. 
"I was scared when I got back there (to serve)," Wetzel said of the final play. "When I saw it roll off the back of her hand I was excited because it got us into state." 
Alma (0-13 7A/6A-Central) knew what was at stake going into the game, and the Airedalettes needed a sweep or a big win in three games to keep their postseason hopes alive. 
Early on, it looked like it might be Alma's night as the Airedalettes raced out to a 2-0 lead after wins of 28-26 and 25-21 in the first two games. 
Siloam Springs came roaring back with a big win, 25-14, in game three, which all but ended Alma's hopes of earning a tiebreaker advantage. 
The Lady Panthers then won game four before outlasting the Airedalettes in game five. 
Alma led 15-14 and had match point in game five after a kill from sophomore Katelyn Kuykendall, but a kill from Shaylon Sharp tied it at 15. Sharp and Krysten Hall then combined for a block to take a 16-15 lead. 
Alma junior Alyssa Hoyle tied the game 16-16 with a kill, but Siloam Springs pulled back ahead 17-16 on a kill from Sharp to set up Wetzel's game-winning ace. 
"These girls could have folded after game two," said Siloam Springs coach Rose Cheek-Willis. "I give credit to the girls. They regrouped and laid down the hammer." 
Sharp led the Lady Panthers with 18 kills, while freshman Ellie Lampton had 15 kills. Freshman setter Chloe Price had 31 assists and 12 digs, while junior Meg Gray had 18 assists. Senior Madisyn Fullerton had 30 digs, while Andrea Lowry had 12 digs. 
Hoyle led Alma with 17 kills and 32 digs. Abbye Ostrander had 19 digs and 11 assists for the Airedalettes, while Jordyn Collyar had 30 digs and Madi Brown 17 assists. 
"We knew we needed to win in three," said Alma coach Tiffaney Drinkwitz. "I hate it for our kids. I'm disappointed for them, but not disappointed in them. They played hard and played with a lot of heart and energy." 
Sports on 10/16/2015
